meanings.definition: The act of taking care of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her caretaking of the injured bird showed her kindness.
meanings.sent2: The caretaking of the elderly requires patience and compassion.
meanings.sent3: The caretaking of the mischievous puppy was a challenge but also fun.
meanings.sent4: His caretaking of the garden turned it into a colorful paradise.
meanings.sent5: The caretaking of the delicate flowers required gentle hands.

meanings.definition: The responsibility of looking after a person or property.
meanings.sent1: The caretaking of the house fell on her shoulders while her parents were away.
meanings.sent2: Property caretaking involves ensuring the safety and maintenance of buildings.
meanings.sent3: His caretaking of the cookies meant they were safe from his hungry siblings.
meanings.sent4: The caretaking of the ancient artifact was a heavy burden on the museum staff.
meanings.sent5: The caretaking of the family heirlooms was a task she took very seriously.

meanings.definition: The job or activity of looking after a place or building.
meanings.sent1: His caretaking of the school involved cleaning and maintenance tasks.
meanings.sent2: Caretaking of the park includes keeping it clean and safe for visitors.
meanings.sent3: The caretaking of the haunted house was surprisingly peaceful.
meanings.sent4: Her caretaking of the historic building preserved its beauty for future generations.
meanings.sent5: The caretaking of the lighthouse was a lonely but important duty.
